meanings.sent1: The naggy customer kept complaining about the service.
meanings.sent2: Her naggy attitude made it hard to enjoy the outing.
meanings.sent3: The naggy cat meowed nonstop until it got its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The naggy raindrops tapped on the window all night long.
meanings.sent5: The naggy teacher always pointed out mistakes in red pen.

meanings.definition: Annoyingly persistent in demanding attention or complaining
meanings.sent1: The naggy child kept asking for candy at the store.
meanings.sent2: His naggy behavior made it difficult to focus on work.
meanings.sent3: The naggy alarm clock refused to stop ringing in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The naggy mosquito buzzed around my head all night.
meanings.sent5: The naggy neighbor always knocked on the door for small favors.

meanings.definition: Tending to nag or criticize in an irritating way
meanings.sent1: Her naggy comments about his outfit made him self-conscious.
meanings.sent2: The naggy boss never seemed satisfied with anyone's work.
meanings.sent3: The naggy parrot mimicked every sound in the house, driving everyone crazy.
meanings.sent4: The naggy wind kept blowing the leaves back onto the freshly raked lawn.
meanings.sent5: The naggy sibling always found something to nitpick about during family gatherings.
